gurmukhi: bXUh sYnw sjo Gor bwjy bjo koit joDw gjo Awn nyry ]
transliteration: Byooh Sainaa Sajo Ghor Baaje Bado Kottee Jodhaa Gado Aan Dere||
translation: Even if there is siege of army on all the four sides and there may be the resonance of horrible sound of war-drums and millions of warriors may roar near me;

gurmukhi: swj sMjoA sMbUh sYnw sBY Awj mwro qrY diRsit qyry ]
transliteration: Saaj Sanjoa Sanbooh Sainaa Sabhai Aaj Mdaro Darai Dristtee Dere||
translation: Even then I shall, on wearing my armours, destroy them within your sight;

gurmukhi: ieMdR jIqo kro j`C rIqo DnM nwir sIqw brM jIq ju`DY ]
transliteration: Indra Jeeto Daro Jachchh Reeto Dhanan Daar(i) Seetaa Baran Jeet Juddhai||
translation: I shall conquer Indra and loot all she treasure of Yaksha and after winning the war, I shall wed Sita.

gurmukhi: surg pwqwl Awkws juAwlw jrY bwic hY rwm kw mor kRU`DY ]381]
transliteration: Surag Paataal Aakaas Juaalaa Darai Baach(i) Hai Raam Kaa Mor Kruddhai||381||
translation: If with the fire of my fury, when the sky, netherworld and heaven burn, then how Ram will remain safe before me?381.

gurmukhi: qwrkw jwq hI Gwq kInI ijnY Aaur subwh mwrIc mwry ]
transliteration: Tarkaa Jaat Highaat Keeni Jinai Aur Soubaah Maarich Mdare||
translation: He who has killed Taraka, Subahu and Marich,

gurmukhi: bXwD b`DXo KrMdUKxM Kyq QY eyk hI bwx soN bwl mwry ]
transliteration: Byaadh Baddhyo Karandookhanan Khet Thai Ek Hibaan Son Baal Mdare||
translation: And also killed Viradh and Khar-Dushan, and killed Bali with one arrow;

gurmukhi: A`Cwd Aau jwNbu mwlI blI pRwx hIxM krXo ju`D jY kY ]
transliteration: Achchhaad Au Jaanb(u) Maalibalipraan Heenan Daryo Juddh Jai Kai||
translation: He who has destroyed Dhumraksha and Jambumali in the war,

gurmukhi: mwirhYN qoih XO sXwr ky isMG jXo lyihgy lMk ko fMk dYkY ]382]
transliteration: Maarihain Toh(i) Yaoun Syaar Ke Singh Jyo Lehege Lank Ko Dank Daikai||382||
translation: He will conquer you by challenging you and kill you like a lion killing a jackal.382.

gurmukhi: caur cMdRM krM C`qR sUrM DrM byd bHmw rrM duAwr myry ]
transliteration: Chaur Channdran Karan Chhattra Sooran Dharan Bed Brahmaa Raran Duaar Dere||
translation: The moon waves the fly-whisk over my head, the sun catches hold of my canopy and Brahma recites Vedas at my gate;

gurmukhi: pwk pwvk krM nIr brxM BrM j`C ib`idAw DrM kIn cyry ]
transliteration: Paak Paavak Karan Neer Baranan Bharan Jachchh Biddiaa Dharan Keen Cdere||
translation: The god of fire prepares my food, the god Varuna brings water for me and the Yakshas teach various sciences;

gurmukhi: Arb KrbM purM crb srbM kry dyKu kYsy krO bIr KyqM ]
transliteration: Arab Kharaban Puran Charab Saraban Dare Dekh(u) Kaise Karau Beer Khetan||
translation: I have enjoyed the comforts of millions of heavens, you may see how I kill the warriors;
